passage_text: There are two types of anatomy: gross, or macroscopic, and microscopic. Gross anatomy deals with things that can be viewed by the unaided eye. Microscopic anatomy is the study of structures on the cellular level. There are, in turn, 3 fields of study within the topic of gross anatomy.

1 Microscopic anatomy is known as histology which is the study of tissues. 2  This is the very basis of anatomy. 3  Histo=web or tissue and-logy=Study of. 4  Developmental anatomy is the development of anatomy. 5  Embryological anatomy is a subset of developmental as it’s limited to the embryo inside the womb.

Cartilage is a type of connective tissue composed of special cells known as chondrocytes along with collagen or yellow elastic fibers. The fibers and the cells are embedded in a firm gel like matrix rich in mucopolysaccharides. Cartilage is not as hard and rigid as bone. It is much more flexible and elastic.

Different types of anatomy. 1  Gross anatomy involves anything that could be seen with your unaided eye. 2  Surface anatomy is a subset of gross anatomy that is anything that can be revealed on the skin. 3  Microscopic anatomy is known as histology which is the study of tissues. 4  Histo=web or tissue and-logy=Study of. 5  Developmental anatomy is the 6  ...
